amendment.description: Amendment sought to increase funding for the National Park Service by $62 million and the Bureau of Indian Affairs by $27.55 million and reduce fossil energy research and development funding by $137.8 million.
amendment.purpose: An amendment, printed as amendment No. 34 in the Congressional Record of June 18, 1996 to increase the funds appropriated for operating expenses of the National Park System by $62 million; Indian Houseing by $27.5 million; and Indian education by $27.5 million. The amendment would reduce the funds of the Department of Energy for fossil fuel research and development by a comparable amount.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Walker amendment (A003) Failed by recorded vote: 196 - 224 (Roll no. 252).
